reporting-org.narrative: International Network for Bamboo and Rattan(INBAR)

title.narrative: CAPACITY BUILDING / TECHNOLOGY TRANSFER AND PROVISION OF BASIC EQUIPMENT, ENTREPRENEURSHIP AND BDS FOR EAST AFRICAN SME’S

description.narrative: To build capacity and technology transfer; to provide trainings on bamboo value chain and entrepreneurship

participating-org.narrative: International Network for Bamboo and Rattan (INBAR)
International Network for Bamboo and Rattan (INBAR)

recipient-country.narrative: Provide capacity building training for bamboo SME and industries. Moreover, training and capacity building was provided on entrepreneurship and tools for SME. In addition a course curriculum will be developed

Provide capacity building training for bamboo SME and industries. Moreover, training and capacity building was provided on entrepreneurship and tools for SME. In addition a course curriculum will be developed
Provide capacity building training for bamboo SME and industries. Moreover, training and capacity building was provided on entrepreneurship and tools for SME.

sector.narrative: Generate green jobs to ensure climate change mitigation and adaptation benefits
Provide SME and industry based employment for youth and women

title.narrative: Trainings on entrepreneurship and bamboo value chain. Start of the development of course curriculums

comment.narrative: Conducted 21 skill and technical training for 475(270M/205F)beneficiaries; 2 trainings organised on entrepreneurship and business development for 76(49M/27F) beneficiaries(https://www.inbar.int/bamboo-beehives-ethiophia/); 11SMEs supported with improved tools to enhance their production efficiency; 4 TVET curriculum which comprises with TTLM(teaching, training and learning materials) developed and course will be introduced in Ethiopia TVET institutes during the academic year July2022. To date, the programme have achieved 107 skill training to reach 3108(1726M/1382F) beneficiaries; 15 entrepreneurship and business development services(BDS) training; 56 enterprise supported with basic tools and 4 TVET bamboo curriculum.

Organized 45 technical and capacity building trainings for 1265(609M/656F) beneficiaries on diversified products in value chains, i.e., bamboo furniture, jewelry, bamboo container, bamboo baskets, and bamboo bio-plastic products. 6 entrepreneurship and business development services(BDS) training organized for 149(73M/76F) beneficiaries. 4 curriculums are in progress with TVET- CDACC in Kenya, and two curriculums on certificate and diploma on bamboo cultivation and resource utilization(BCRU) has been initiated in partnership with Nyabyeya Forestry College in Uganda. 32 enterprise supported with tools and fixtures to enhance SME efficiency , 3 online training courses organized in collaboration with ICBR; NFGA; Zhejiang A&F University and Yunnan Academy of Forestry and Grassland on bamboo standards; bamboo cluster & multi- supply chain; and management of Sympodial bamboo for 197(149M/48F) beneficiaries, 2 TVET bamboo curriculum (L1 &L2) developed in Ethiopia, 4 curriculums with TVET-CDACC in progress, and Nyabyeya Forestry College, Masindi, Uganda is also developing 2 bamboo curriculum. To date, the programme have achieved 86 skill training to reach 2633(1456M/1177F) beneficiaries; 13 entrepreneurship and business development services(BDS) training; 45 enterprise supported with basic tools and 2 TVET bamboo curriculum (L1 &L2) developed in Ethiopia,

The programme organised a total of 41technical skill development training for SME entrepreneurs and industry workers benefiting 1247 (782M/465F), eight trainings on entrepreneurship and business developments were provided for 121(65M/56F).Tools and equipment were provided to 16 enterprises for improving the product quality and enhance the production efficiency. The preparatory works for the development of TVET course curriculum in Kenya (TVET-CDACC) and Nayabeya Forestry College, Uganda is in progress.
135 trainings to give on bamboo value chain; 30 training on entrepreneurship; 3 CIDCA/MOFCOM training; 4 curriculum to be developed. 5000 people to be trained.
